title: Authorizes the issuance of warrants and orders of protection in persons in need of supervision cases
summary: Authorizes the issuance of warrants and orders of protection in persons in need of supervision cases.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2276

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 14, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ROBINSON, SCARBOROUGH, TITUS, PAULIN, PERRY,
         N. RIVERA -- read once and referred to the Committee on  Children  and
         Families

       AN ACT to amend the family court act, in relation to warrants and orders
         of protection in persons in need of supervision cases

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Subdivision (g) of section 735 of the family court act,  as
    2  added  by  section  7  of  part  E of chapter 57 of the laws of 2005, is
    3  amended to read as follows:
    4    (g) (i) The designated lead agency shall promptly give written  notice
    5  to the potential petitioner whenever attempts to prevent the filing of a
    6  petition  have  terminated,  and  shall  indicate in such notice whether
    7  efforts were successful. The  notice  shall  also  detail  the  diligent
    8  attempts  made  to divert the case if a determination has been made that
    9  there is no substantial likelihood that  the  youth  will  benefit  from
   10  further  attempts.  No  persons  in  need of supervision petition may be
   11  filed pursuant to this article during the  period  the  designated  lead
   12  agency is providing diversion services. A finding by the designated lead
   13  agency  that  the  case  has been successfully diverted shall constitute
   14  presumptive evidence that the underlying allegations have been  success-
   15  fully  resolved in any petition based upon the same factual allegations.
   16  No petition may be filed pursuant to this article by the parent or other
   17  person legally responsible for the youth where diversion  services  have
   18  been  terminated  because  of  the failure of the parent or other person
   19  legally responsible for the youth to consent to or actively participate.
   20    (ii) [The] EXCEPT AS PROVIDED IN PARAGRAPH (III) OF THIS  SUBDIVISION,
   21  THE clerk of the court shall accept a petition for filing only if it has
   22  attached thereto the following NOTICES:
   23    (A)  if the potential petitioner is the parent or other person legally
   24  responsible for the youth, a notice  from  the  designated  lead  agency

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00253-01-1

       A. 2276                             2

    1  indicating  there  is no bar to the filing of the petition as the poten-
    2  tial petitioner consented to  and  actively  participated  in  diversion
    3  services; and
    4    (B)  a  notice  from  the  designated  lead agency stating that it has
    5  terminated diversion services because it has determined that there is no
    6  substantial likelihood that the youth and his or her family will benefit
    7  from further attempts, and that  the  case  has  not  been  successfully
    8  diverted.
    9    (III) THE CLERK OF THE COURT SHALL ACCEPT A PETITION FOR FILING IF:
   10    (A)  THE  POTENTIAL  PETITIONER  IS  REQUESTING THAT THE COURT ISSUE A
   11  WARRANT PURSUANT TO SECTION SEVEN HUNDRED  THIRTY-EIGHT  OF  THIS  PART,
   12  BECAUSE  THE  RESPONDENT HAS ABSCONDED FROM THE HOME AND IS UNABLE TO BE
   13  LOCATED; OR
   14    (B) THE POTENTIAL PETITIONER IS REQUESTING  THAT  THE  COURT  ISSUE  A
   15  TEMPORARY  ORDER  OF PROTECTION, PURSUANT TO SECTION SEVEN HUNDRED FORTY
   16  OR SEVEN HUNDRED FIFTY-NINE OF  THIS  ARTICLE,  BECAUSE  THE  RESPONDENT
   17  POSES  AN IMMINENT RISK OF HARM TO THE POTENTIAL PETITIONER OR MEMBER OF
   18  HIS OR HER HOUSEHOLD.
   19    S 2. Subdivision (b) of section  742  of  the  family  court  act,  as
   20  amended  by  section  9  of part E of chapter 57 of the laws of 2005, is
   21  amended to read as follows:
   22    (b) At the initial appearance  of  the  respondent,  the  court  shall
   23  review  any  termination of diversion services pursuant to such section,
   24  and the  documentation  of  diligent  attempts  to  provide  appropriate
   25  services  and  determine  whether  such efforts or services provided are
   26  sufficient and may, subject to the provisions of section  seven  hundred
   27  forty-eight  of  this  [article]  PART,  order that additional diversion
   28  attempts be undertaken by the designated  lead  agency.  The  court  may
   29  order  the  youth and the parent or other person legally responsible for
   30  the youth to participate in diversion services. AT THE  INITIAL  APPEAR-
   31  ANCE  OF  THE RESPONDENT ON A PETITION FILED IN ACCORDANCE WITH SUBPARA-
   32  GRAPH (A) OF PARAGRAPH (III) OF SUBDIVISION (G) OF SECTION SEVEN HUNDRED
   33  THIRTY-FIVE OF THIS ARTICLE, THE COURT SHALL REFER  THE  RESPONDENT  AND
   34  PARENT  TO THE DESIGNATED LEAD AGENCY FOR DIVERSION ATTEMPTS, UNLESS THE
   35  COURT DETERMINES THAT THERE IS A SUBSTANTIAL LIKELIHOOD THAT  THE  CHILD
   36  WOULD ABSCOND OR THAT IT WOULD BE CONTRARY TO THE CHILD'S BEST INTERESTS
   37  FOR  SUCH  EFFORTS  TO  BE  UNDERTAKEN. AT THE INITIAL APPEARANCE OF THE
   38  RESPONDENT ON A PETITION FILED IN ACCORDANCE WITH  SUBPARAGRAPH  (B)  OF
   39  PARAGRAPH  (III) OF SUBDIVISION (G) OF SECTION SEVEN HUNDRED THIRTY-FIVE
   40  OF THIS ARTICLE, THE COURT SHALL REFER THE RESPONDENT AND PARENT TO  THE
   41  DESIGNATED  LEAD  AGENCY FOR DIVERSION ATTEMPTS, UNLESS THE COURT DETER-
   42  MINES THAT THE CHILD CONTINUES TO POSE AN IMMINENT RISK TO THE PETITION-
   43  ER OR A MEMBER OF HIS OR HER HOUSEHOLD OR THAT IT WOULD BE  CONTRARY  TO
   44  THE  CHILD'S  BEST  INTERESTS  FOR SUCH EFFORTS TO BE UNDERTAKEN. If the
   45  designated lead agency thereafter determines that [the] A case  REFERRED
   46  FOR  DIVERSION  EFFORTS  UNDER  THIS  SUBDIVISION  has been successfully
   47  resolved, it shall so notify the court, and the court shall dismiss  the
   48  petition.
   49    S  3.  This  act shall take effect on the ninetieth day after it shall
   50  have become a law and shall apply to petitions filed on  or  after  such
   51  effective date.
